misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No misconception detected (correct parallel-array sorting and selection)
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that sorting the scores array must be accompanied by swapping the corresponding names in the names array so the pairing stays aligned, and that after sorting ascending, the top student is at index n-1.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: There is no gap here: in Java, arrays are indexed consistently, and performing the same swaps on both arrays correctly maintains the name–score association. After an ascending sort, the maximum score is indeed at the last index.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: None (produces correct output for valid inputs).
